qas.question: Which angel is believed to have communicated the Quran to Muhammad?
On which date did Muhammad begin receiving the Quran?
In which year CE did Muhammad die?
What is the Arabic variant of Gabriel?
How many times is the word "Quran" used in the Quran?
Which devil is believed to have communicated the Quran to Muhammad?
On which date did Muhammad stop receiving the Quran?
In which year CE did Muhammad get sick?
What is the Jewish variant of Gabriel?
How many times isn't the word "Quran" used in the Quran?

context: Muslims believe the Quran was verbally revealed by God to Muhammad through the angel <a0_0><b5_0>Gabriel<b5_0/><a0_0/> (<a3_0><b8_0>Jibril<b8_0/><a3_0/>), gradually over a period of approximately 23 years, beginning on <a1_0><b6_0>22 December 609 CE<b6_0/><a1_0/>, when Muhammad was 40, and concluding in <a2_0><b7_0>632<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the year of his death. Muslims regard the Quran as the most important miracle of Muhammad, a proof of his prophethood, and the culmination of a series of divine messages that started with the messages revealed to Adam and ended with Muhammad. The word "Quran" occurs some <a4_0><b9_0>70<b9_0/><a4_0/> times in the text of the Quran, although different names and words are also said to be references to the Quran.
